attributes.comment:
Currently the process to adopt from China has increased from 9 months to 14-16
months and is getting longer. This does not even account for the time that it takes
from the time you submit your I600A and fingerprinting and when you get approved
by the I171H months later. Combined, it is highly likely that your applications
(I171H) will expire before your adoption is completed and you are going to have to
pay twice. Your review and justifications for increasing rates is extensive, but fails
to account for changes in the processing time by the US and foreign governments.
I assume that you chose the original expiration dates (15 mos. for fingerprinting
and 18 mos. for the I171H) based on the normal timeframes for adoption. Before
increasing the rates, you should incorporate these increased timeframes to adopt
or reduce the fees when renewing to accomodate the increased adoption times. I
hope you were at least that aware of this! There is legislation to increase the
expiration dates, but it has not passed as yet. Don't increase the rates
anticipating passage. Wait.

Comment on FR Doc # E7-01631
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by John Wu
